meanings.definition: The time required for half of the atoms of a radioactive substance to undergo decay.
meanings.sent1: The halflife of the radioactive element was measured in days.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the halflife of the substance in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The halflife of the radioactive material seemed to take forever to pass.
meanings.sent4: The halflife of the element ticked away like a slow, steady clock.
meanings.sent5: The concept of halflife made the decay process easier to understand.

meanings.definition: The time required for half of a quantity of a substance to undergo a specified process or reaction.
meanings.sent1: The halflife of the medication was shorter than expected.
meanings.sent2: The halflife of the chemical reaction was crucial for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The halflife of the solution made the scientists scratch their heads in confusion.
meanings.sent4: The halflife of the substance was like a race against time.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the halflife of the substance was key to the experiment's success.
